result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Richard Hebert

records.addlTxt: 10:25 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Tyler Richard Hebert in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Tyler Richard Hebert.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Satorius recites joint agreement on Ct 1 for Deferred Judgment of Conviction. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Disorderly Conduct in 22CM402.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM402.  Court withholds sentence in favor of DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CM402 for 9 months.  Diversion program to update the Court halfway through and at the end of the program. Adjourned at 10:44 AM. bph

9:22 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Tyler Richard Hebert in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Tyler Richard Hebert.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Atty Satorius states this matter will be resolved asking for a PLEAS. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:23 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Debra H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:36 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler Richard Hebert in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Tyler Richard Hebert.  DE confirms address and does qualify for PD. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
